name: Technology Transfer Agreement
description: Comprehensive agreement for transferring technology, know-how, and IP rights

requiredFields.name: Technology Description
requiredFields.description: Detailed description of technology being transferred

requiredFields.name: Patent Information
requiredFields.description: List patents if applicable (number, title, country)

requiredFields.name: Field of Use Restriction
requiredFields.description: Any limitations on use (leave blank if none)

requiredFields.name: Royalty Rate (%)
requiredFields.description: Percentage of net sales (0 if none)

sections.title: Parties
sections.content:
This Technology Transfer Agreement ("Agreement") is entered into as of {{date effective_date "MMMM DD, YYYY"}} ("Effective Date") by and between:

{{provider_name}} ("Provider"), a [corporation/university] organized under the laws of [JURISDICTION], and

{{recipient_name}} ("Recipient"), a corporation organized under the laws of [JURISDICTION].

Provider and Recipient may be referred to individually as a "Party" and collectively as the "Parties."

sections.title: Recitals
Definitions
sections.content:
1. DEFINITIONS

1.1 "Technology" means {{technology_description}}, including all related {{#each transfer_components}}{{this}}{{#unless @last}}, {{/unless}}{{/each}}.

{{#if patents}}1.2 "Patent Rights" means: {{patent_list}} and any related continuations, divisionals, and foreign counterparts.{{/if}}

1.3 "Know-How" means all technical information, data, materials, trade secrets, and expertise related to the Technology.

1.4 "Confidential Information" means all non-public information disclosed by either Party.

{{#if field_of_use}}1.5 "Field of Use" means: {{field_of_use}}.{{/if}}

1.6 "Territory" means: {{#each territory}}{{this}}{{#unless @last}}, {{/unless}}{{/each}}.

sections.title: Technology Transfer
Training and Support
sections.content:
3. TRAINING AND SUPPORT

3.1 Training Program. Provider shall provide training as follows:
{{training_details}}

3.2 Technical Support. Provider shall provide reasonable technical support for [12] months after initial training.

3.3 Documentation. Provider shall provide comprehensive technical documentation and updates during the support period.

prompts.system: You are structuring technology transfer training requirements.
prompts.user: Create a detailed training plan based on: {{training_details}}

sections.title: Financial Terms
Acceptance and Testing
sections.content:
5. ACCEPTANCE

5.1 Acceptance Period. Recipient shall have [60] days after delivery to test and evaluate the Technology.

5.2 Acceptance Criteria. The Technology shall be deemed accepted if it meets the specifications in Exhibit A.

5.3 Remedies. If Technology fails acceptance, Provider shall have [30] days to cure deficiencies.

5.4 Deemed Acceptance. Technology is deemed accepted if Recipient fails to provide written notice of deficiencies within the acceptance period.

sections.title: Intellectual Property
Confidentiality
Export Control
sections.content:
8. EXPORT CONTROL

8.1 Compliance. Both Parties shall comply with all applicable export control laws and regulations.

8.2 Classification. The Technology is classified as [EAR99/ECCN] under US export regulations.

8.3 Restrictions. Recipient shall not export, re-export, or transfer the Technology without appropriate licenses.

8.4 Certifications. Recipient certifies it is not on any prohibited party lists.

sections.title: Warranties and Indemnification
sections.content:
9. WARRANTIES

9.1 Provider Warranties. Provider warrants:
(a) It has the right to transfer the Technology;
(b) The Technology does not knowingly infringe third-party rights;
(c) The Technology will perform materially as described.

9.2 DISCLAIMER. EXCEPT AS STATED ABOVE, TECHNOLOGY IS PROVIDED "AS IS" WITHOUT ANY OTHER WARRANTIES.

9.3 Indemnification. Each Party shall indemnify the other for breaches of its warranties and representations.

sections.title: Term and Termination
sections.content:
10. TERM AND TERMINATION

10.1 Term. This Agreement continues for {{term_years}} years from the Effective Date.

10.2 Termination. Either Party may terminate for material breach not cured within sixty (60) days' notice.

10.3 Effect. Upon termination:
(a) {{#if assignment}}Technology rights remain with Recipient{{else}}All licenses terminate{{/if}};
(b) Confidentiality obligations survive;
(c) Accrued payment obligations remain.

sections.title: General Provisions
sections.content:
11. GENERAL PROVISIONS

11.1 Governing Law. This Agreement is governed by the laws of {{governing_law}}, without regard to conflicts of law.

11.2 Dispute Resolution. Disputes shall be resolved through binding arbitration under [ICC/AAA] rules.

11.3 Entire Agreement. This Agreement constitutes the entire understanding between the Parties.

11.4 Assignment. Neither Party may assign without the other's written consent, except to affiliates or successors.

sections.title: Signatures
sections.content:
IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this Agreement as of the Effective Date.

PROVIDER:
{{provider_name}}

By: _____________________________
Name:
Title:
Date:

RECIPIENT:
{{recipient_name}}

By: _____________________________
Name:

Date:
